oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Construction of the First Rhodium(I) Cyclic Pentameric Structure [Rh(CO)Cl{(mu-(NBuP)-Bu-t)(2)(C equivalent to CPh)(2)}](5) Using (Phenylethynyl)cyclodiphosphazanes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SIDDIQUI, MM
MAGUE, JT
BALAKRISHNA, MS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: TRANSITION-METAL CHEMISTRY
FUNCTIONALITIES SYNTHESIS
COPPER(I) COORDINATION
REVERSIBLE CONVERSION
CYCLODIPHOSPHAZANES
COMPLEXES
MACROCYCLE
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: To examine the steric effect of the phosphorus substituents in cyclodiphosphazanes, two less sterically demanding alkynyl-functionalized cis-[(mu-(NBuP)-Bu-t)(2)(C CPh)(2)] (1) and trans-[(mu-(NBuP)-Bu-t)(2)(C CPh)(2)] (2) were synthesized. The cis isomer 1, with a large subtending angle (135.8 degrees) upon treatment with [Rh(CO)(2)Cl](2), afforded the first rhodium(I) cyclic pentameric macrocycle [Rh(CO)Cl{(mu-(NBuP)-Bu-t)(2)(C CPh)(2)}](5) (3). The crystal structure of the cyclic pentamer 3 closely resembles a classical Ferris wheel.
